data.title: Upscale Cafe
data.text: Nice eclectic decor ( see pictures ).  We were there on a Friday and we both had the Fish & Chips special.  Two Cod fillets, generous portion of fries and tartar sauce.  Tasted good but not exceptional.  The server was very attentive and parking was available on the street. I thought it was a bit expensive at $11.00 for the Fish & Chips special. See Photo of "Specials Menu"

data.title: Great burger
data.text: Nice place in downtown Garland to have lunch.  Had a fabulous burger and tri-salad plate.  Food came out fast and was very good.

data.title: Nice basic food
data.text: Ate hear about a month ago and enjoyed the food. I had the Chicken Fried Steak and it was very tender and crispy. Service was very good. Only problem was that it was a very plain room in a very plain location next to a busy street. Your were almost afraid to make a noise! Menu seemed a little limited.

data.title: Love  this cafe
data.text: Have been here several times. Chicken Nathan is still my favorite. Tried fried pork chops this time. Good and crispy. Others at table tried fish and chips, hamburger steak and chicken fried chicken. They serve beer and wine but no Marguaritas. Oh well still good.

data.title: Food was amazing!
data.text: Yumm!!!!! The food was so good here.  It was like there is a old grandma cooking with love in the back! We had burgers and the Chicken dish that has the soup poured over it.  So good, already planning when I am coming back.

data.title: Food is incredible!!
data.text: Quaint little place, nicely decorated and clean on the square in downtown Garland. This was my first time to try this place and I was not disappointing, neither was any of my company. The food was amazing. We ate there during out lunch break and got in and out under an hour. Good amount of food and the specialty iced tea is great!  I had the crispy buffalo chicken sandwich. It was perfect, the chicken cooked perfect, the bread was so good, fresh lettuce and tomato. Service was quick and friendly. Even the owner stopped by to say hello. I will definitely be back.

data.title: If the owners read these reviews.....
data.text: I hope they do, as they need to address the issue of maintaining their establishment.  I've raved about this restaurant in the past and still think it has very good food, but something I've noticed makes me lose my appetite when I eat there.  Dirt!!!  I ate there recently and again noticed dirty baseboards in the dining room and bathroom.  This may seem like a small thing to many, but it always makes me wonder what the kitchen looks like (how clean or UNCLEAN it is) when there's obvious dirt elsewhere.  And a little fresh paint (clean the dirt away first, please!) would go a long way in helping, too.  Loved the live music on my last visit and the service was okay.  I will mention that servers standing around chatting and laughing loudly (especially when you're waiting on them to take your order) takes away from the "ambiance."  I sometimes get the feeling that there's a confusion about what kind of restaurant Main Street wants to be.  Table cloths and cloth napkins vs. dressed down servers who call the customers "sweetie".  And in addition to that, it's never polite to comment on the customers appetite ("Boy, you sure did finish that off!").  I'll still recommend Main Street for the good food and value, but it definitely needs to put a little polish on its interior and servers to be a really good restaurant.

data.title: YUMMY!!!
data.text: I've only been here a couple of times for lunch, but each time it was FANTASTIC! The last time I was here, it was on April 27, 2016 and a co-worker treated me to lunch for Admin. Assistant's Day. I got a cup of the Poblano Chicken Soup and the Chicken Caesar Wrap - delicious! I was really surprised at the amount of soup you get with a cup - it was definitely a generous portion. I plan to go back for dinner with my hubby!

data.title: best burgers in texas
data.text: wow you want a great juicy burger this is the place, cooked to order every time, fresh toppings and sides. Try the truffle fries- excellent

data.title: Best chicken fried steak in the area
data.text: Tried this because they advertise chicken fried steak special on Thursdays. I was not disappointed. Huge portions! We could've shared a plate. There was even live music. Will definitely return.

data.title: Home style cooking
data.text:
Main Street Cafe is your old style cafe with a down home comfort food menu and a homey atmosphere. A perfect place to curl up when you don't want to go anywhere fancy and basic good food.

The restaurant is nothing fancy from the outside. It is right on the street with limited parking in front. It is what you would envision a 1950's dinner to be like with large plate glass windows and a few posters advertising the local activities. The floors are polished concrete, in contrast with the tables all of which have white tablecloths and napkins. The walls are relatively plain but brightly colored, but what I liked were the neat touches like a small reading area with a few books that I remember from my childhood days. Placed against the wall was an old wood display display case that formerly held books but was being used as a wine case. Really highlighted the old small town cafe.

Food was what you would have expected from an old style diner. We focused on the chicken friend steak and chicken fried chicken after being told that they had just ran out of the pork chops, dang it. Actually there were two types of chicken fried chicken. I went after the chicken Nathan with the poblano sauce and parmesian potatoes.

Both dishes were pretty good. I requested the poblano gravy on the side. I think the gravy is actually the poblano soup. Quite good. It had just a slight bit of kick to it an was not overwhelmingly hot. I ate it like a soup and will probably order it as a soup in the future. The gravy on the chicken fried steak was much thicker but not as interesting.  Typical gravy for chicken fried steak.  The batter is heavier than most places but more reminiscent of what Southerners make at home.  The sides were definitely made from scatch.  A bit heavier than a like, but still very good.

Niether of us had room for dessert and we did have leftovers.  

Service is very friendly (once again, typical of a small town diner) and we gabbed with the waitress for quite a bit of time.  

We will be back.

data.title: Tight  boss
data.text: making customer tip when they on limit income I well never go back tight  rude owner fellowing outside

data.title: Real Food Served Here
data.text: My wife and I frequent Main Street Café in Garland.  We are always looking for restaurants that serve real food in a quiet atmosphere where friends can visit.  The norm in U.S. restaurants is to make the place so noisy that you don't want to hang around and they can turn the tables.  Main Street Café serves several meals that are cooked well from real ingredients and are well spiced.  We recommend their chicken Cesar salad, chicken fried steak and chicken and meatloaf.  Don't miss a bowl of their chicken poblano soup with a couple of pieces of corn bread.

data.title: Delicious grilled pimento cheese.
data.text: I get this every time we eat here. I got one to go yesterday and it was yummy. The pimento cheese has pecans and jalapenos.  The chips are ok but the sandwich was so good i didnt mind. Next time I will pay extra to have a different side.

data.title: Mrs
data.text: This was our second visit. Asked waitress for suggestion on menu for our meal. She recommended Chicken Nathan. Oh my goodness how wonderful and oh so good. More than I could eat. Took some home and enjoyed it later. Also took home some Pecan Cobbler. Best I have ever had. Great place for date night

data.title: Very attentive staff
data.text: Good experience while at garland and their burgers are epic, a bit pricey for what the food really is. their home cooking is good but not as extraordinaire as led to believe.

data.title: From Happy to Sad
data.text: My husband and I first found Main Street Café about a year ago.  We tried it and LOVED it.  Soft music, quiet crowd, great food, great waiter, several homemade desserts to choose from.  We were so excited to finally have a quiet restaurant so close to home that had a table cloth and gave us an upscale dinner where we could enjoy each others company and not be bothered by screaming kids or loud patrons at a bar.  We returned over and over.  After a few months we noticed our normal waiter was gone and the last time we went our waiter didn't even know the menu or if they even had a dessert and our drinks were never refilled even once.  So sad. The first time we went I had the salmon and asparagus...so delish. The last time we went I had the chicken and needed a saw to cut it.  My husband mentioned the loud patrons behind him.  He was surprised when I told him it was two ladies who worked there that were talking to patrons.  There food was cold by the time the two ladies let them eat.  Food quality is down.  Service is down.  Atmosphere is down.

data.title: Excellent for Family and Friends
data.text: Great place to meet with friends or Family!! Cute Place very Unique like your at Home!! Great Food and atmosphere!! Excellent staff there and they make your Dining experience or Lunch a Great one!! Best Place downtown Garland to eat at!!

data.title: Great food!
data.text: I have never been disappointed by the food I have ordered from here.  Love supporting small businesses!

data.title: Small Town Cafe or Diner
data.text: I was in search of a family owned small town cafe or diner for home cooked type meal. I was pleasantly surprised to find one in the Dallas Metroplex in the city Garland where I live. Hungry for a Texas Staple, Chicken Fried Steak, I discovered The Main Street Cafe. Located on main street of down town Garland near the town square. Upon entering I was surprised to find not a little cafe but more like dinner place with table cloth, water glasses, and flatware prepared table. But upon seating by a waiter and look at the menu the surprise turned to joy to find hamburgers, salads, and most important chicken fried steak on the list of items. The prices were a little high $12 for the chicken fried steak with two sides but I was starving. I ordered the steak with mash potatoes cream gravy and black eyed peas. I was very pleased with batter on the steak not to much just right very well seasoned. The potatoes were indeed real not from a box and thick cream gravy. I recommend any looking for the home cooked meal served in a restaurant give the Main Street Cafe in Garland a try.
